name: next
purpose: Advance the internal array pointer of an array

return.description:
Returns the array value in the next place that's pointed to by the
   internal array pointer, or FALSE if there are no more elements.This function may
return Boolean FALSE, but may also return a non-Boolean value which
evaluates to FALSE, such as 0 or
"". Please read the section on Booleans for more
information. Use the ===
operator for testing the return value of this
function.

notes.description:
You won't be able to distinguish the end of an array from a
    boolean FALSE element. To properly traverse an array
    which may contain FALSE elements, see the each
    function.
